meanings.definition: To make or become thicker or more dense.
meanings.sent1: She thickened the soup by adding more flour.
meanings.sent2: The sauce thickened as it simmered on the stove.
meanings.sent3: The plot thickened when the detective found a hidden clue.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room thickened as the argument escalated.
meanings.sent5: The fog thickened, making it hard to see beyond a few feet.

meanings.definition: Having a relatively great extent from one surface to the opposite; not thin.
meanings.sent1: The thickened book had over 500 pages.
meanings.sent2: The tree trunk was thickened with age and growth rings.
meanings.sent3: The traffic thickened as more cars joined the highway.
meanings.sent4: Her accent thickened when she got excited.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room thickened, making everyone uneasy.
